page.title: 01Barton Hill and surrounds
page.content: This section lies to the south west of the Howardian Hills. It is rolling contryside levelling out to the plain of the VAle of York to the west. The main railway line and trunk road A64 from York to coast at Scarborough cross this section. It is mainly cereal and vegetable farming with some lifestock. There are two principal villages, Flaxton and Barton- Le- Willows. A mixture of old (red brick and stone) and modern houses flank the sides of the village streets which are bordered with broad grassed areas. The land is drained by ditches to the Spitalbeck taking water down to the river Derwent.
